intro: Linaria semiglabra, commonly known as the smooth flaxflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces clusters of yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, giving it a slightly rough texture. Linaria semiglabra is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates.
